result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas F Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cost to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

No contact with victim.  Follow through with current treatment regimen.  Follow through with any recommended Mental Health Care.  
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas F Schmitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Court orders discharge from Probations supervision on 01/18/2016.
dated Jan 13, 2016 from DOC regarding early release
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas F Schmitz in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court returns the letter from the Vet Center filed on 5/28/15.

Court orders the following:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $343.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- GPS Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  No contact with victim.  Follow through with current treatment regimen.  Follow through with any recommended Mental Health care.
(1) from employer and (1) from Vet Center (letter from Vet Center returned to the defendant in court on 5/29/15 without being scanned)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas F Schmitz in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant Thomas F Schmitz in court with attorney Ronald Sonderhouse for Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
